newsitem.title: UK: BANK OF ENGLAND ENDS ECONOMIST'S SOCCER DREAM-PAPER.
newsitem.headline: BANK OF ENGLAND ENDS ECONOMIST'S SOCCER DREAM-PAPER.

text.p: The Bank of England's chief economist Mervyn King has been prevented from becoming a non-executive director of Aston Villa soccer club by the bank's governor Eddie George, the Times reported on Tuesday.
The newspaper said the decision could mean a delay in the planned 140 million stg ($229.6 million) stock market flotation of the premier league side, of which King has been a life-long supporter.
George told King that being a director of a commercial company could produce a conflict of interests with the bank's activities, the paper said.

The Times said the bank's apparent attitude was at odds with that prevailing in other sectors of the public sector where senior civil servants were actively encouraged to take non-executive directorships.
-- Dan Lalor, London Newsroom +44 171 542 8863 ($ = 0.609 British Pounds)
